main event: Ira Maxey, a veteran radar bombardier, reported seeing flying objects in the sky near Fort Worth, Texas, on April 9, 1950, and took photographs of them.
interesting points: Maxey claimed to see objects coming out of the west and traveling northeast at high speed., The objects emitted a thunderous sound as they moved., Photographs taken were considered to have intelligence value and were investigated by the Air Force., The sighting occurred around 6:30 p.m., and the objects were reportedly six or seven miles away., Local radar installations reported no unusual activity at the time.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects in the sky
